controllers

Class GameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controllers.GameController

  • public class GameController
extends Object
    The overall controller of a Monopoly game. It provides access to all basic actions and activities for the game. All other activities of the game, should be implemented by referring to the basic actions and activities in this class. This is necessary, since the GUI does not support MVC yet. Note that this controller is far from being finished and many things could be done in a much nicer and cleaner way! But, it shows the general idea of how the model, view (GUI), and the controller could work with each other, and how different parts of the games activities can be separated from each other, so that different parts can be added and extended independently from each other. Note that it is crucial that all changes to the Game need to be made through this controller, since the GUI does not follow the MVC pattern. For fully implementing the game, it will be necessary to add more of these basic actions in this class. The action methods of the Space and the Card can be implemented based on the basic actions and activities of this game controller. Then, the game controller takes care of updating the GUI.
    Author:
    Ekkart Kindler, ekki@dtu.dk

    • Method Detail

      • createPlayers

        public void createPlayers()
        This method will be called when the game is started to create the participating players. Right now, the creation of players is hard-coded. But this should be done by interacting with the user.

      • LoadPlayersAndProperties

        public void LoadPlayersAndProperties()
        Load players from DB to game logic and gui.

      • initializeGUI

        public void initializeGUI()
        This method will initialize the GUI. It should be called after the players of the game are created.

      • play

        public void play()
        The main method to start the game with the given player. The game is started with the current player of the game; this makes it possible to resume a game at any point.

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove(Player player)
              throws PlayerBrokeException
        This method implements a activity of asingle move of the given player. It throws a PlayerBrokeException if the player goes broke in this move. Note that this is still a very basic implementation of the move of a player; many aspects are still missing.
        Parameters:
        player - the player making the move
        Throws:
        PlayerBrokeException - if the player goes broke during the move

      • moveToSpace

        public void moveToSpace(Player player,
                        Space space)
                 throws PlayerBrokeException
        This method implements the activity of moving the player to the new position, including all actions associated with moving the player to the new position.
        Parameters:
        player - the moved player
        space - the space to which the player moves
        Throws:
        PlayerBrokeException - when the player goes broke doing the action on that space

      • gotoJail

        public void gotoJail(Player player)
        The method implements the action of a player going directly to jail.
        Parameters:
        player - the player going to jail

      • takeChanceCard

        public void takeChanceCard(Player player)
                    throws PlayerBrokeException
        The method implementing the activity of taking a chance card.
        Parameters:
        player - the player taking a chance card
        Throws:
        PlayerBrokeException - if the player goes broke by this activity

      • returnChanceCardToDeck

        public void returnChanceCardToDeck(Card card)
        This method implements the action returning a drawn card to the bottom of the deck.
        Parameters:
        card - returned card

      • obtainCash

        public void obtainCash(Player player,
                       int amount)
        This method implements the activity where a player can obtain cash by selling houses back to the bank, by mortgaging own properties, or by selling properties to other players. This is called, whenever the player does not have enough cash available for an action. If he does not at least free the given amount of money, he will be broke; this is to help the player make the right choices to free enough money.
        Parameters:
        player - the player
        amount - the amount the player should have available after the act

      • offerToBuy

        public void offerToBuy(Property property,
                       Player player)
                throws PlayerBrokeException
        This method implements the activity of offering a player to buy a property. This is typically triggered by a player arriving on an property that is not sold yet. If the player chooses not to buy, the property will be set for auction.
        Parameters:
        property - the property to be sold
        player - the player the property is offered to
        Throws:
        PlayerBrokeException - when the player chooses to buy but could not afford it

      • payment

        public void payment(Player payer,
                    int amount,
                    Player receiver)
             throws PlayerBrokeException
        This method implements a payment activity to another player, which involves the player to obtain some cash on the way, in case he does not have enough cash available to pay right away. If he cannot free enough money in the process, the player will go bankrupt.
        Parameters:
        payer - the player making the payment
        amount - the payed amount
        receiver - the beneficiary of the payment
        Throws:
        PlayerBrokeException - when the payer goes broke by this payment

      • paymentFromBank

        public void paymentFromBank(Player player,
                            int amount)
        This method implements the action of a player receiving money from the bank.
        Parameters:
        player - the player receiving the money
        amount - the amount

      • paymentToBank

        public void paymentToBank(Player player,
                          int amount)
                   throws PlayerBrokeException
        This method implements the activity of a player making a payment to the bank. Note that this might involve the player to obtain some cash; in case he cannot free enough cash, he will go bankrupt to the bank.
        Parameters:
        player - the player making the payment
        amount - the amount
        Throws:
        PlayerBrokeException - when the player goes broke by the payment
